messages.title: VOTE FOR CHANGE
messages.content: We can’t go on like this. It’s time for change.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Protecting the NHS, putting single sex wards at the QMC, more health visitors to support Nottingham's mums, scraping targets for Nottingham’s hospitals, and GP greater access on NHS dentistship.
Helping our teachers to improve classroom discipline by cutting the ties that shackle our teachers.
Supporting Nottinghamshire Police by cutting paperwork and getting our bobbies back on the beat fighting crime and tackling anti-social behaviour.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Voting for anyone else will only help Gordon Brown cling on to power. So please – for the sake of our great country – don't miss your chance to vote for change.

issues.education: Local teachers should decide how best to deliver our children’s education. Allowing teachers to deal with violent children.
issues.health: Local doctors should decide how to fulfil their community’s health needs. Bringing maternity units and inpatient rehabilitation back into the NHS.
issues.socialWelfare: Conservatives are committed to cutting the deficit, sleeping rough initiative, support school uniform and breakfast club actions.

leaflet.personalStatement: I believe passionately that local people know what their community needs and that power should be given back to our communities from Westminster.

contactInformation.address: King Edward Court, King Edward Street, Nottingham, NG1 1EW

images.caption: Dr Rowena Holland for Nottingham South, pictured with local people and working on health and education issues.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet contains a quote from David Cameron, urging voters to vote for change, and underlines the urgency of voting for the Conservatives to bring new ideas and energy for the UK's future.
